text: The Port of Beirut () is the main port in Lebanon on the eastern part of the Saint George Bay on Beirut's northern Mediterranean coast. It is west of the Beirut River. It is one of the largest and busiest ports on the Eastern Mediterranean.The Economy (Major Sectors of the Economy) , Lebanese Embassy of the U.S. On 4 August 2020, two large explosions happened at the port, killing at least 220 people, and injuring more than 5,000 others.Cabinet declares state of emergency, port officials placed under house arrest , Daily Star (5 August 2020). ==References== Beirut Category:Beirut
title: Port of Beirut
